definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: This politician has done a lot of shameful things.
sentences.chinese: 这个政客做了很多见不得人的事。

sentences.english: You dig up the past, all you get is dirty.
sentences.chinese: 你把过去一股脑儿都挖了出来，那可都是见不得人的。

sentences.english: Do nothing secretly; for Time sees and hears all things, and discloses all.
sentences.chinese: 莫做见不得人之事，时间知道一切，也会揭露一切。

sentences.english: That old man's revenge has been blacker than my sin.
sentences.chinese: 那老人的复仇比我的罪过更见不得人。

sentences.english: There is less stigma attached to illegitimacy now than there used to be.
sentences.chinese: 私生子女已不像过去那样见不得人了。

sentences.english: He made an immoral living procuring women for tourists in the city.
sentences.chinese: 他靠为旅客拉皮条而过着见不得人的生活。

definition: to offend Heaven and reason (idiom); bloody atrocities that cry to heaven/outrageous acts
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
(of a person) honorable/not devious/(of a behavior) fair and aboveboard/without tricks/openly/(of a situation) out in the open
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
